answers.text:
Hello Debbie,
I was able to find some city-wide surveys administered by various organizations which can hopefully act as a starting point for your own city-wide surveys.
Here is a sample city-wide survey from Olathe, Kansas:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/12083/Olathe_Municipal_Services_Quarterly_Customer_Satisfaction_Survey
This is a survey administered to several cities nationwide.  It asks a variety of questions to determine customer satisfaction.  This also includes the results of the survey for Dover, Delaware:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302432/The_National_Citizen_Survey_City_of_Dover_DE
This is a presentation on communication with the community.  It includes a helpful section on surveys:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7357/Tools_for_Communication_Marketing_Surveys_and_Outreach
I hope this helps you get started on a city-wide survey.
Gabriel Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Debbie Cravey
text: We are trying to create one customer satisfaction survey that can be utilized by all departments vs. each department using a customer satisfaction survey unique to their department.  Does anyone have a survey they use city-wide?
title: Customer Satisfaction Survey
